required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Smartphone Based Screening Tool for Neonatal Jaundice in Surabaya, Indonesia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Smartphone Based Screening Tool for Neonatal Jaundice in Surabaya, Indonesia

brief_summary.textblock: A cross-sectional conductive study aiming to evaluate the accuracy of a novel smartphone application that estimates bilirubin levels in newborns in Surabaya.

detailed_description.textblock:
A cross-sectional conductive study aiming to evaluate the accuracy of a novel smartphone application that estimates bilirubin levels in newborns at Airlangga University hospital and RSIA Kendangsari MERR in Surabaya.
This cross-sectional study evaluates the accuracy of a novel smartphone application that estimates bilirubin levels in Indonesian newborns. The Picterus Calibration Card was placed on the chest of the newborn with the hole in the card placed over the infant's sternum. A validated smartphone with Picterus JP was used to collect digital images.

primary_outcome.measure: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of newborns, independent of skin color, using Picterus JP.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate of smartphone-based screening tool (Picterus JP) for neonatal jaundice in Indonesian newborns.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between bilirubin estimates in from a smartphone application and bilirubin measurements in serum in newborn
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the correlation between bilirubin estimates in from a smartphone application and bilirubin measurements in serum in newborns with varying degree of jaundice

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between bilirubin estimates from a smartphone application and bilirubin estimates from a standard transcutaneous device in newborns
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the correlation between bilirubin estimates from a smartphone application and bilirubin estimates from a standard transcutaneous device in newborns with varying degree of jaundice

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between bilirubin estimates from a smartphone application and bilirubin estimates from visual inspection in newborns
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the correlation between bilirubin estimates from a smartphone application and bilirubin estimates from visual inspection in newborns with varying degree of jaundice

arm_group.arm_group_label: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns
arm_group.description: In this study we aim to collect data of newborns with wider range of bilirubin levels to adjust the Picterus JP algorithm and optimize the app performance. This will enable a high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns for all skin colors.

intervention.description: In this study we aim to collect data of newborns with wider range of bilirubin levels to adjust the Picterus JP algorithm and optimize the app performance. This will enable a high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns for all skin colors.
intervention.arm_group_label: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns
